result.execSummary:
The defendant Christa Marie Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Set at $2,060.00 to North Shore Bank.  Joint and several with Danielle Tyacke
-----------------
Court waived court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments due to large amount of restitution to be paid on  this case and case 15CF2345.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first two years of sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Mental health assessment.  Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician.
No contact with NOrth Shore Bank located at 9131 W. Oklahoma Avenue or Susan K.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with North Shore Bank located at 9131 W. Oklahoma Avenue, Susan K.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modfication Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
DNA sample and related surcharge waved, as defendant provided a sample and  paying fee on 15CF2345.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christa Marie Williams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christa Marie Williams in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Christa Marie Williams in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for  99 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 45 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 54 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first 2 years of sentence.
-Restitution set at $2,060.00 joint/several with Danielle Tyacke payable to North Shore Bank.  Restitution to be paid before any Court costs, fees and assessments, and are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Court WAIVED Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments due to large amount of restitution to be paid on this case and case 15CF2345.  
-DNA sample sample and related surcharges are WAIVED as defendant is providing a sample and paying fees on 15CF2345. 
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-No contact with North Shore Bank located at 9131 W. Oklahoma Avenue; Susan K.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Christa Marie Williams in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Christa Marie Williams in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Christa Marie Williams not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 21.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, Defendant Christa Marie Williams not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christa Marie Williams in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Christa Marie Williams in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY NORTH SHORE BANK.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christa Marie Williams in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Christa Marie Williams in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
